title: England set to be at full-strength for Rugby World Cup semi-final clash with New Zealand
text:
England head coach Eddie Jones is expected to have a fully-fit squad for the first time during their World Cup campaign when they face New Zealand in the semi-final on Saturday, with Jonny May and Jack Nowell both expected to be available.

Nowell, who missed the quarter-final victory over Australia, is on course to recover from a hamstring injury having made a try-scoring return from a long-term lay-off in the pool victory over Argentina.

May, meanwhile, suffered a minor hamstring injury after scoring two first-half tries on his 50th cap in the 40-16 victory over the Wallabies.

description: England head coach Eddie Jones is expected to have a fully-fit squad for the first time during their World Cup campaign when they face New Zealand in the semi-final on Saturday, with Jonny May and Jack Nowell both expected to be available.
